item.title: Valve to make Source Engine SDK free
item.dc:creator: higgsboson
item.description:
sersoft:

in b4 that means Black Mesa doesn’t require any purchase from Valve and therefore cannot be released on the Source engine.

… why? Just because the SDK is free doesn’t mean BM can’t be on Source, it’s entirely unrelated.

item.source: Valve to make Source Engine SDK free

item.title: Valve to make Source Engine SDK free
item.dc:creator: Medevilae
item.description:
Kairouseki:

What the hell is up with Valve and giving stuff out for free. I’m not complaining I just think it’s kind of weird.

They’re about to start on a new engine in secret, and are trying to lengthen Source (1?)'s life in the meantime. DOTA2 may be the last Source game out by Valve.

That’s baseless btw, completely. It’d be cool though.

Read full topic
item.source: Valve to make Source Engine SDK free

item.title: Valve to make Source Engine SDK free
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
Kairouseki:

What the hell is up with Valve and giving stuff out for free. I’m not complaining I just think it’s kind of weird.

They usually have other motives.

Portal 1 free for a month was to get more people on steam plus help with the mac launch.

TF2 free is because they will make more money selling items than the game.

Alien Swarm was to get more steam users and experiment with almost entirely user generated content based games.

Its a different kinda business tactic but it seems to be working.

Read full topic
item.source: Valve to make Source Engine SDK free

What the hell is up with Valve and giving stuff out for free. I’m not complaining I just think it’s kind of weird.

It’s called clever marketing. Would you rather have Activision running the show?

item.title: Valve to make Source Engine SDK free
item.dc:creator: Jeannotvb
item.description:
Source is a great engine, but from what I remember working with Alien Swarm it cannot compete with the Unreal Development Kit (also free for non-commercial use). If Valve wants to do what Epic Games is doing then they seriously need to change the development environment.

Read full topic

item.title: Valve to make Source Engine SDK free
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
While the Source Engine SDK will soon be free, it looks like amateur game developers will still require that a Source Engine game be installed before playing any mods created via the Source Engine SDK

DENIED
